result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Francis Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

8:48 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Brian Francis Anderson. Defendant Brian Francis Anderson in court. Court reviews case. ADA Ellenwood recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to Count 1: Criminal Trespass to Dwelling WITHOUT repeater- 943.14(2). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
    Count 1: 

- $400.00 Fine, Inclusive - Suspended


Other Conditions:

- DNA Sample

Cash bond to be refunded to payor. 

Adjourned 09:02 AM

1:04 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court. Defendant Brian Francis Anderson in court, in custody. Court reviews case.  DE states why missed appearance. ADA Becker states DE was picked up on an Eau Claire Co warrant. DE states Eau Claire Co. Warrant was taken care of this morning. Court sets STC. Court quashed Stayed warrant. Adjourned 01:21 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Brian Francis Anderson not in court. Court reviews case. Atty Dolfi states an offer was received and DE wanted some time to think the offer over. ADA Becker makes statements. Court issues warrant- stayed until 10/14 PM. Adjourned 10:07 AM

Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

$200 bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, William W. or any properties owned by BNA Property LLC unless with written consent.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:51 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. DA:  Karl Anderson with Student Intern Ali Casey   DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi for today     Brian Francis Anderson appeared. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument; bond ordered. NG.  Waive speedy trial. Court sets STC via Zoom to allow time for Atty Dolfi to receive and review discovery for potential motions. Adjourned at 1:55 PM.  gll  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
